teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Teachers for Change
teams.loan_because: "A hundred years from now, it will not matter what kind of car I drove, what kind of house I lived in, how much money I had in the bank...but the world may be a better place because I made a difference in the life of a child."
teams.description: "We all teach citizenship and caring with everything we do. This group is going to allow us to show it in force. No Child Left Behind taken to the higher level, out of politics and into concern for all the families of our global neighborhood."  -A Team member

teams.name: Calvary Lutheran Church Women
teams.loan_because: Since God's grace is already ours, we can put to rest all questions about whether God loves us: the cross and empty tomb prove he loves us. God's gift of heaven means we don't have to worry about where we stand with God anymore. Instead, we can live confident that God plans to be gracious to us, and wants the best for us and for the world. And we turn our attention to the world God loves.
teams.description: We are the Women of Calvary Lutheran wanting to promote women's efforts for independece and self-sufficiency.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Brigham Young University
teams.loan_because: We went to learn and have since graduated and gone out to serve.
teams.description: BYU is a school with a high level of standard in not only academia but moral conduct and service. Many of the students have spent a year and a half or two years living abroad, learning a language and culture while serving the people.

teams.name: Team Japan
teams.loan_because: we feel that we can help the world, one person at a time.
teams.description:
There are many Kiva lenders who live in Japan, and we hope to be able to make a difference, not only as individuals, but now as a team. Please feel free to join us....not only from anywhere in Japan, but anywhere in the world. All you need is an interest in Japan.

teams.name: Newstep Team
teams.loan_because: 1. Restock ones shop. 2. To buy tools for ones plantation. 3. To buy bigger kitchen utensils for my popcorn stall.
teams.description: This a family-based team. We live together and different ways of earning money. One is running a corner shop,  one is selling popcorns to local students and the other in the plantation. We help each other in daily needs by cooking food, washing, cleaning etc. We want to take our home business to the next step and that is why we want to loan money to upgrade that. Thank You for making our dream come true!

teams.loan_because: We are dedicated to raising awareness and fundraising for Prostate Cancer research.  We loan for those who share our passions about finding a cure.
teams.description: The Movember movement is bringing the Mo back because weâ€™re passionate about tackling menâ€™s health issues and being proactive in the fight against prostate cancer.  And while hairs slowly (very slowly) grown above our lips, we will try to raise funds and donate to others who will use the funds for research to find better treatments and a cure for cancer's around the world.

teams.name: Hospital & Healthcare Management Suppliers Profile-Elekta
teams.description: Elekta is an international medical technology group, providing meaningful clinical solutions, comprehensive information systems, and services for improved cancer care and management of brain disorders.

teams.name: Wacky Monkeys for a Cause
teams.loan_because: we care.
teams.description:
We're a group of friends across the US (and one in the UK) who met online and many have met "in real life". Some of us have walked the Komen Breast Cancer 3Day together (in San Diego and Dallas), and some of us, the NY WalkMS. We don't have a plan for this year, so I'm hoping some of the Wacky Monkeys will join me here in helping to fund some women entrepreneurs.

Updated Nov 15 2009:
Since my idea didn't take off with my monkeys, I'm throwing the group open.

If you like monkeys, join us! 
 :()

teams.name: Team in Training
teams.description: Team in Training (TNT) raises funds for the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society to find a cure for blood cancers. Team in Training participants commit to raising money for LLS while training to complete an endurance event in honor of a special teammate who is fighting cancer.

http://goo.gl/LU3hzz

teams.name: Crazy Canucks
teams.loan_because: We live in a well-to-do nation and want to help those less fortunate than ourselves
teams.description: We are CANADIAN !!!

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: Tecate
teams.loan_because: We're suspicious of everything and everyone down here. The dominant theme is that the rich will never let the poor get ahead and will do everything in their considerable power to keep them down. But Kiva is the real deal, and even though we're not a rich nation, we're definitely not the poorest -- not by a long shot. Few folks realize that, but this team is well aware and knows that our middle class is slowly wobbling its way up to firmer plateaus. We can help those that are truly needy self-starters, especially with Kiva and its field partners doing the groundwork.
teams.description:
We're just average folks who struggle to get ahead and have our share of setbacks, but we're optimistic about our individual prospects and enjoy enough good times and successes to keep our heads up. We identify with Kiva entrepreneurs and know we are far luckier and well able to lend 25 honestly-earned dollars now and again -- what we like to call our "granito de arena" (grain of sand).


By the way, we're not affiliated with the brewer of Tecate beer. We merely drink its product.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Circle of Strength
teams.loan_because: We believe women will make the greatest difference in the success of our communities.
teams.description:
We support women in business because we believe that if women are self supportive they not only help their families but their communities.

Our motto is "Strengthening Women & Strengthening Communities"

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Purdue University
teams.whereabouts: West Lafayette, Indiana, Earth, and Beyond!
teams.loan_because: As a land-grant university with a strong commitment to sustainable development around the world, we whole-heartily support efforts to help alleviate global poverty.
teams.description: The Purdue University Kiva Lending Team welcomes all students, faculty, staff, alumni and friends of Purdue University.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.description: We are Buddhists of all variety, but focus here is on the way of the Boddhisatva.

teams.name: Maria Shriver + A Woman's Nation
teams.loan_because: For as little as $25, we can help women entrepreneurs right in our own backyard.
teams.description:
Continuing what she began as First Lady of California, Maria Shriver and A Womanâ€™s Nation are partnering with Kiva, the world's first person-to-person microlending website, to empower thousands of women across America to become more financially independent. Our partnership shows that every loan you make to a woman entrepreneur â€“ even $25 â€“ will make a real difference. 

As "The Shriver Report: A Womanâ€™s Nation Pushes Back from the Brink"* states, 1 in 3 American women lives on or near the brink of poverty. By starting or expanding her own business, a woman can lift herself and her family off the brink. JOIN US in moving women and families forward!

A Womanâ€™s Nationâ„¢ is a nonprofit organization founded by Maria Shriver that imagines a new way forward for women and men, girls and boys. Through its multimedia initiatives and innovative partnerships, A Woman's Nation informs, inspires, and implements bold ideas into action with the goal of creating a culture where all lives and all work are respected, recognized, and valued. To learn more please visit AWomansNation.org.
 
* A project of A Woman's Nation, produced in partnership with Center for American Progress.

teams.name: Fight Fistulas
teams.loan_because:
This team was founded after some members were profoundly touched by the documentary - "A Walk to Beautiful" - which can now be viewed at  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3w-fOmovijc.  

The 9 min video "Fistula Pilgrims" tells the story of Telanish, a young girl in Ethiopia who was married at 10, pregnant at 11 and gave birth to a stillborn child at 12. As a result of a long and obstructed labour, she has a fistula and is left incontinent, an outcast from her community: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6K7BLR6MQ0E

"From Despair to Dignity" is a short but powerful 5 minute video: http://www.yaninamanolova.com/fistula/index.html

Some of our team members have visited the Fistula Hospital in Addis Ababa in Sept 2010. You can find the photos of our trip here: http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1498836905487.2071607.1071085140&type=1&l=37cf97fe75
teams.description:
We make Kiva loans in recognition of the Hamlin Fistula Hospital and its supporters worldwide, which fight to correct a childbirth injury that can leave a young woman incontinent, leaking wastes, scorned and ostracized.  A $450 surgical repair usually solves the problem and restores their lives.  For more information, please check out the pages of the different global partners and donors of the Hamlin Fistula Hospital:

Japan: http://english.fistula-japan.org
Netherlands: www.fistulahospital.nl 
New Zealand: www.hamlinfistula.org.nz
Sweden: www.fistulasjukhuset.se
Switzerland: www.womenshope.ch
UK: www.hamlinfistulauk.org
USA: http://www.hamlinfistulausa.org; http://www.fistulafoundation.org

Search the web and do your online shopping through iGive to help us raise more funds for fistula patients: www.iGive.com/fight-fistulas.

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

"Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime."
teams.description: We help because we can! We are not in the 3rd world and it's going to take a combined effort to help those who are.

teams.description: The University of Washington (or UDub) is a large public university in Seattle, Washington committed to making a difference.

teams.name: Intel Small Things Challenge
teams.loan_because: Every small, individual action can make a big difference -- especially if millions participate. A modest micro-loan will give an entrepreneur a hand-up to start a new business and provide for his or her family.
teams.description:
Intel is the corporate sponsor of the Small Things Challenge. The company is providing financial support as well as providing opportunities throughout the year to increase global awareness for the issues addressed by the Small Things Challenge â€“ providing opportunities so children in developing countries can attend primary school and their parents can earn higher incomes.
The Intel Small Things Challenge builds upon Intelâ€™s 40 years of active involvement in education. The company is again investing about $100 million in education in 2009. Over the last decade, Intel has invested over $1 billion and Intel employees have donated more than 2 million hours towards improving education in 50 countries.  
Individuals can provide support and find more information about the Small Things Challenge â€“ including the online petition and a video featuring musicians and actors who support the cause â€“ at www.smallthingschallenge.com.

teams.name: TechCrunch
teams.loan_because: We believe in the power of entrepreneurs to change the world.
teams.description: People who are enthusiastic about technology, startups, and change.

teams.name: Startup Founders - every individual and business has the power to make a difference
teams.loan_because: We all need to work together to make the world a better place.
teams.description: Startup Founders supporting fellow entrepreneurs thru microfinance to grow their businesses and make their lives and their world a better place

teams.name: University of Maryland
teams.loan_because: We loan because of many reasons, but we are joined by the years we spent at College Park, though not necessarily at the same time.
teams.description: This group represents the University of Maryland in all its Black and Gold glory.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Mr. Clipper's "Alpacas for Kiva"
teams.loan_because: Mr Clipper Alpaca Shearing is dedicated to living in a world where we give each other a helping hand. We don't believe in the traditional notions of charity. We think that giving someone the tools to empower themselves is volumes better than a free handout. Kiva is one of the best organizations to come around in a long time. They bring people together in a way that enables them to help each other from across the globe. We share in Kiva's commitment to making the world a better place through micro-finance and are dedicated to bringing all of our clients the satisfaction of knowing that they have helped someone make a positive impact in their lives.
teams.description: Over the last several years I have gotten to know many of my clients well, and can count them as my friends. I know that the people I work for are some of the best and most generous individuals on the planet. Alpacas for Kiva brings these people together under the shared goal of helping Kiva and its lenders. For each farm that Mr Clipper shears, we will give that farm one Kiva loan. We hope that this will sow the seeds for further loans with Kiva and that our team can blossom into an active community of Alpaca owners lending a little spare change to help make the world a better place.

teams.name: Team Tia - Loan Around The Globe
teams.whereabouts: Global with HQ in Murcia, EspaÃ±a
teams.loan_because: We want to show our support for Tia by helping others around the globe. Tia wants to be able to help people and this is a wonderful way to support her.
teams.description: Tia is an eleven year old girl living in Spain who has a number of illnesses including Dilated Cardiomyopathy. We are making loans on Tia's behalf to spread Tia's love around the globe.

teams.name: Jezebels
teams.loan_because: we believe that empowering women by increasing their economic strength benefits all of society.
teams.description: Readers and commenters of jezebel.com, as well as any Kiva loaner who believes in economic gender equality.

teams.name: Norway
teams.loan_because:
We have Cold Weather - Warm hearts !
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty. 

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe.
teams.description:

teams.name: The Million Dollar Project
teams.loan_because: The Million Dollar Project: If we get 2000 members, then at $25/member over 10 years with 19 re-loans we will invest $1,000,000 entrepreneurs in developing countries. Be a part of it!
teams.description:
We would like to see how much a team of five original members can lend in 5 years by percolating through our social networks. Unlike other Kiva teams (Atheists, Christians, Europeans, etc.) we're a team joined together not by who we are and how we define ourselves, but instead by what we want to accomplish: investing $1,000,000 in entrepreneurs in developing countries.

Join our facebook group below!

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

teams.name: University of Hawaii
teams.loan_because: We care.
teams.description: We are a group of Hawaii students looking to make a difference!

teams.name: Kiva Austin Texas
teams.loan_because: We are big-hearted Texans and citizens of the world who enjoy sharing our prosperity and making a positive difference in the world.
teams.description:
a delightfully diverse group of Austinites. Be proud, Team Austin--our Kiva team is second only to NYC (with nearly 4X as many members!) for total lending for a city team. 
And a hearty WELCOME!! to all our new members.

teams.name: Heartland Oklahoma Team
teams.loan_because: Oklahomans are always willing to lend a hand to our neighbors as well as to total strangers.
teams.description: An active team of Oklahomans joining together to fund loans, work toward goals, and have fun with Kiva loan challenges.

teams.name: Beer Goggles Never Lie... much
teams.whereabouts: with a coldie in one hand and a hottie in the other... maybe
teams.loan_because:
We love a beer, and we love to loan. Coincidence? I think not!
By the way, I lurv what you've done with your hair...
teams.description:
Saving the world, one beer (and loan) at a time. Errrrrrrrr, it's your shout, round, whatevaaaaaa... mine's a lager thanks.



Beer is your friend... SO GET IT INTA YAAAAAAAAAA!!!


Beauty is in the eye of the BEER HOLDER...

teams.name: Vanderbilt University
teams.loan_because:
As part of the Vanderbilt Microfinance Club, we strive to increase the ways we battle poverty by investing in others' success. 
With Dr. Muhammad Yunus, a Vanderbilt graduate, as inspiration, we hope to carry on the use of microfinance from the Vanderbilt campus.

â€œLasting peace cannot be achieved unless large population groups find ways in which to break out of poverty. Microcredit is one such means." 
-- Nobel Peace Prize Committee
teams.description: Contact: arielle.r.samet@vanderbilt.edu or jordan.s.solomon@vanderbilt.edu
